doc.previous: The definition of eigenvalue of a linear transformation remains valid even if the underlying space is an infinite dimensional Hilbert or Banach space Namely a scalar is an eigenvalue if and only if there is some nonzero vector such that
doc.after: The functions that satisfy this equation are commonly called eigenfunctions of For the derivative operator an eigenfunction is a function that when differentiated yields a constant times the original function The solution is an exponential function
